title: UK PM Johnson says hopes this is the moment to get Brexit resolution
text:
Prime Minister Boris Johnson is putting his last-minute Brexit deal to a vote in an extraordinary sitting of the British parliament on Saturday.

More than three years since the UK voted to leave the European project, Johnson hopes to win parliament's approval for the divorce treaty he struck in Brussels on Thursday.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) BRITISH PRIME MINISTER, BORIS JOHNSON, SAYING: (SOUNDBITE IS OVERLAID WITH SHOT OF JOHNSON SEEN FROM SIDE)

"The House will need no reminding that this is the second deal and the fourth vote, three and a half years after the nation voted for Brexit. And during those years, friendships have been strained, families divided, and the attention of this House consumed by a single issue that has at times felt incapable of resolution. But I hope, Mr Speaker, that this is the moment when we can finally achieve that resolution and reconcile the instincts that compete within us."

Britain's opposition Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn says the people should have the final say on Brexit.

Adding that his lawmakers would not back Johnson's withdrawal deal.
